alert.note: Alert for Lafayette; Marshall (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 11:17AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Lafayette and south central Marshall Counties through 1145 AM CDT... At 1117 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Harmontown, or 9 miles east of John W Kyle State Park, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Oxford, Harmontown, Abbeville, College Hill Station, Blackwater, College Hill, Teckville and Spraggins. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
